comments.creator: akomarzewski@mozilla.com
comments.text: "User Activity" and "Usage Behavior" sections of [Public Data Report](https://data.firefox.com) stopped updating in December.
comments.raw_text: "User Activity" and "Usage Behavior" sections of [Public Data Report](https://data.firefox.com) stopped updating in December.
comments.author: akomarzewski@mozilla.com

comments.creator: akomarzewski@mozilla.com
comments.author: akomarzewski@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: Hey Su: could you confirm if we should keep all the metrics we currently show in "User Actvity" and "Usage Behavior" sections?
comments.text: Hey Su: could you confirm if we should keep all the metrics we currently show in "User Actvity" and "Usage Behavior" sections?

comments.raw_text:
Hey, 

I don't know of any reason to not keep any of those metrics. I'd say yes, keep all the metrics.
comments.creator: shong@mozilla.com
comments.author: shong@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Hey, 

I don't know of any reason to not keep any of those metrics. I'd say yes, keep all the metrics.

comments.creator: akomarzewski@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
I'm collecting list of metrics and relevant datasets we should use for powering this dashboard here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sc94jXw1NNw-_74gjl7lGq3161yfqhTiDokKl9m1HCM/edit?usp=sharing

Su: what about YAU? I think it doesn't bring much value since we're showing MAU on the same page.
comments.author: akomarzewski@mozilla.com
comments.text:
I'm collecting list of metrics and relevant datasets we should use for powering this dashboard here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sc94jXw1NNw-_74gjl7lGq3161yfqhTiDokKl9m1HCM/edit?usp=sharing

Su: what about YAU? I think it doesn't bring much value since we're showing MAU on the same page.

comments.creator: shong@mozilla.com
comments.author: shong@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Ah, good point!

I agree, I'm okay with removing YAU. Can't think of any reason to keep it, though we should probably run it by the channel to see if there's any missing context.
comments.text:
Ah, good point!

I agree, I'm okay with removing YAU. Can't think of any reason to keep it, though we should probably run it by the channel to see if there's any missing context.

comments.creator: akomarzewski@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Su-Young Hong from comment #4)
> I agree, I'm okay with removing YAU. Can't think of any reason to keep it, though we should probably run it by the channel to see if there's any missing context.

It was discussed and agreed that we can remove YAU.
